description: Washington: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT District of Maine has issued the following order:. UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT District of Maine FRED L. M., Plaintiff, v. ANDREW M. SAUL, Commissioner of Social Security Defendant)))))))) No. 2:19- cv-00159-GZS ORDER AFFIRMING THE REPORT AND RECOMMENDED DECISION OF THE MAGISTRATE JUDGE The United States Magistrate Judge filed...
sourceClass: Government Agencies (U.S.), Government Policy, Local Government, National Government
text:
Washington: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT District of Maine has issued the
following order:

UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT District of Maine FRED L. M., Plaintiff, v.
ANDREW M. SAUL, Commissioner of Social Security Defendant ) ) ) ) ) ) ) ) No.
2:19-cv-00159-GZS ORDER AFFIRMING THE REPORT AND RECOMMENDED DECISION OF THE
MAGISTRATE JUDGE The United States Magistrate Judge filed with the Court on
March 30, 2020, his Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 21). Plaintiff
filed his Objection to the Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 22) on May
13, 2020. Defendant filed his Response to Plaintiff's Objection to the Report
and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 23) on May 21, 2020. I have reviewed and
considered the Magistrate Judge's Recommended Decision, together with the
entire record; I have made a de novo determination of all matters adjudicated
by the Magistrate Judge's Recommended Decision; and I concur with the
recommendations of the United States Magistrate Judge for the reasons set
forth in his Recommended Decision, and determine that no further proceeding is
necessary. 1. It is therefore ORDERED that the Recommended Decision of the
Magistrate Judge is hereby AFFIRMED. 2. It is ORDERED that the Commissioner's
Decision is AFFIRMED. /s/George Z. Singal_____________ U.S. District Judge
Dated this 26th day of May, 2020. Case 2:19-cv-00159-GZS Document 24 Filed
05/26/20 Page 1 of 1 PageID #:

relations.sentence: Washington: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT District of Maine has issued the following order:

ANDREW M. SAUL, Commissioner of Social Security Defendant ) ) ) ) ) ) ) ) No. 2:19-cv-00159-GZS ORDER AFFIRMING THE REPORT AND RECOMMENDED DECISION OF THE MAGISTRATE JUDGE The United States Magistrate Judge filed with the Court on March 30, 2020, his Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 21).

ANDREW M. SAUL, Commissioner of Social Security Defendant ) ) ) ) ) ) ) ) No. 2:19-cv-00159-GZS ORDER AFFIRMING THE REPORT AND RECOMMENDED DECISION OF THE MAGISTRATE JUDGE The United States Magistrate Judge filed with the Court on March 30, 2020, his Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 21).
Plaintiff filed his Objection to the Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 22) on May 13, 2020.
Plaintiff filed his Objection to the Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 22) on May 13, 2020.
Defendant filed his Response to Plaintiff's Objection to the Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 23) on May 21, 2020.
Plaintiff filed his Objection to the Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 22) on May 13, 2020.
Defendant filed his Response to Plaintiff's Objection to the Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 23) on May 21, 2020.

I have reviewed and considered the Magistrate Judge's Recommended Decision, together with the entire record; I have made a de novo determination of all matters adjudicated by the Magistrate Judge's Recommended Decision; and I concur with the recommendations of the United States Magistrate Judge for the reasons set forth in his Recommended Decision, and determine that no further proceeding is necessary.

I have reviewed and considered the Magistrate Judge's Recommended Decision, together with the entire record; I have made a de novo determination of all matters adjudicated by the Magistrate Judge's Recommended Decision; and I concur with the recommendations of the United States Magistrate Judge for the reasons set forth in his Recommended Decision, and determine that no further proceeding is necessary.
1. It is therefore ORDERED that the Recommended Decision of the Magistrate Judge is hereby AFFIRMED.
2. It is ORDERED that the Commissioner's Decision is AFFIRMED.
Singal_____________ U.S. District Judge Dated this 26th day of May, 2020.

Washington: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT District of Maine has issued the following order:

UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT District of Maine FRED L. M., Plaintiff, v. ANDREW M. SAUL, Commissioner of Social Security Defendant ) ) ) ) ) ) ) ) No. 2:19-cv-00159-GZS ORDER AFFIRMING THE REPORT AND RECOMMENDED DECISION OF THE MAGISTRATE JUDGE The United States Magistrate Judge filed with the Court on March 30, 2020, his Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 21). Plaintiff filed his Objection to the Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 22) on May 13, 2020. Defendant filed his Response to Plaintiff's Objection to the Report and Recommended Decision (ECF No. 23) on May 21, 2020. I have reviewed and considered the Magistrate Judge's Recommended Decision, together with the entire record; I have made a de novo determination of all matters adjudicated by the Magistrate Judge's Recommended Decision; and I concur with the recommendations of the United States Magistrate Judge for the reasons set forth in his Recommended Decision, and determine that no further proceeding is necessary. 1. It is therefore ORDERED that the Recommended Decision of the Magistrate Judge is hereby AFFIRMED. 2. It is ORDERED that the Commissioner's Decision is AFFIRMED. /s/George Z. Singal_____________ U.S. District Judge Dated this 26th day of May, 2020. Case 2:19-cv-00159-GZS Document 24 Filed 05/26/20 Page 1 of 1 PageID #:
